page.title: 02Landscape around Fearn
page.content: The area within our grid is basically flat farmland.Few trees are evident but many roads are lined with beech hedges.The verges also contain whins, wild brambles and cow parsley but these are cut back during the summer.Because of the flatness and the soil fertility field sizes have been increased.Excessive rain and clay soils also cause some fields to flood at certain times of the year.The village of Hill of Fearn stands out because of its situation on a knoll. It has remained a compact unit even though many new council houses have been built in recent years.Arabella can hardly be described as a village-it's really a cluster of houses which have arisen because of its situation at a crossroads.
